long_desc.thetext: bug 214334 defines an API for modeling AST transformations to use this the CDT must be able to apply this transformations to source files. The source change generator creates the org.eclipse.ltk.core.refactoring.Change objects based on a AST transformation. The Generator should use existing source code if possible and should only generate new code if necessary e.g. for synthetic AST trees. Thus, the formatting should be obtained for reused code, generated code should be formatted following the formatter configuration.

Emanuel, I am assigning the bug to you. We need your contribution to make this happen for 5.0 and from our previous conversations I know you are willing to do that.
I have committed the package org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.dom.rewrite which provides the information for the change generator. All of that can be adjusted as we need it. Here the most important methods from the initial suggestion:
ASTRewriteAnalyzer.rewriteAST(IASTTranslationUnit, ASTModificationStore): This method needs to be implemented to create the change object.
ASTModificationStore.getRootModifications(): Returns the modifications done directly to the translation unit.
ASTModificationStore.getNestedModifications(ASTModification): Returns the nested modifications for a modification.
I have modelled 3 different modifications that all operate on a target node and introduce a new node (exception: REPLACE may be used without a new node) REPLACE INSERT_BEFORE APPEND_CHILD (the special case of inserting a node as the last child)
We are adapting the our existing AST Writer to the new modification api and the additionals requirements. I'll contribute the first version as soon as possible.

Created attachment 90855 First implementation of the change generator
The ChangeGenerator creates changes from the ASTModifications. The current version works for all our Tests and the refactoring we have adapted to the new API. The names of the changes are still hard coded and the use of the TextEditGroup is not yet implemened properly and not tested. The comment handling is nearly finished and tested. Missing are test that uses the comment handling during refactoring.

Thanks again for the contribution!
There are two small formal issues, which I can fix myself before applying the patch. Just to let you know: * the copyright notice should show the year 2008 * in a few String literals the package 'hsrrefactoring' is still used.
Markus.

This code is completely undocumented and uncommented.
I appreciate the work that went into this, but we really need to be considering the implications of accepting a large chunk of code without any documentation whatsoever.
This is part of a school project or thesis right? Does that mean there will be a paper on how this works? Is there something available now?
Doug, if you truly intend to do something about the documentation problem, now is the time.

(In reply to comment #7) > Doug, if you truly intend to do something about the documentation problem, now > is the time.
Yes, please document your code.

(In reply to comment #8) > (In reply to comment #7) > > Doug, if you truly intend to do something about the documentation problem, now > > is the time. > > Yes, please document your code. >
Oh, and Mike, go apply some patches.
Are there any guidelines on what should be documented?

(In reply to comment #9)
> Oh, and Mike, go apply some patches.
Whats that supposed to mean?
This is obviously an impressive piece of work, and I want to be able to appreciate it better. I'm not trying to take anything away from Emanuel and the hard work he and his colleges have done, but at the same time I'm interested in having a CDT core thats well documented and maintainable. The code looks to be of high quality, and having API docs to go along with it would make this contribution even better.
Doug, I mentioned you personally because you said on your blog that as project lead you take responsibility for fixing this. Now I admit I should have used more tact in my previous post, but getting mad at me isn't going to help anything. I'm the one that noticed that there's no docs here, otherwise this may have just flown under the radar. And believe me I'll make a big stink again if people keep trying to commit stuff with no docs. Would you prefer I stop caring about the doc issue? Because right now it seems I'm the only one who's actively doing anything about it.

(In reply to comment #10) > Are there any guidelines on what should be documented?
http://java.sun.com/j2se/javadoc/writingdoccomments/

(In reply to comment #7)
> This is part of a school project or thesis right? Does that mean there will be > a paper on how this works? Is there something available now?
Your right we did't comment our code this is mainly because Peter Sommerlad our boss considers comments as usless our even harmfull. Only code tells the truth. But maybe we should change our comment policy for the cdt work.
This patch is based on my diploma thesis but we finished the diploma thesis over a year ago and a lot has changed since then.
Is there a piece of cdt code that can serve as an example for the desired level of documentation? specially for internal API.
Just to make everything clear. We'll create a comment patch for this code and the refactoring patch. (Bug 181493)

attachment.desc: First implementation of the change generator
